titleInfo.title: Letter, Anna Jones in Allegheny City, Pa. to David L. Jones in Nashville, Tenn., 1865 June 07

mods.abstract: 1865, June 7 Anna M. Jones in Allegheny City, Pa., to her husband David L. Jones in Nashville, Tenn. Greets him and discusses the status of their children. Speculates as to when he should be coming home. Discusses whose fault it might be for him not getting his bounty. Hopes he will be home before long but not to worry about them financially. Speculates as to what work might be most profitable for either one of them when he returns. Assures him that they do not want for anything, but she would prefer being busier and thus contributing more financially.

subject.topic: Army spouses -- Pennsylvania -- Allegheny City -- History -- 19th century -- Correspondence
